alert.note: Alert for Buckingham; Campbell; Charlotte (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 22 at 9:22PM EDT until June 23 at 12:00AM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1115 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of central Virginia and south central Virginia, including the following counties, in central Virginia, Appomattox, Buckingham and Campbell. In south central Virginia, Charlotte. * WHEN...Until 1115 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 919 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated the heavy rain due to thunderstorms has ended. However, minor flooding is expected to continue through late evening. Between 1 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen since 7pm. - Maple Springs Branch and Left Hand Fork south of Appomattox is the most likely place to experience minor flooding. - Other locations that will experience flooding include... Appomattox... Charlotte Court House... Phenix... Red House... Bent Creek... Pamplin City... Evergreen... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of flooding, including mudslides or flooded roads, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on Twitter.
